meanings.definition: A flavoring extract prepared from the cured seed pods of a tropical orchid.
meanings.sent1: I added a drop of vanilla to the cake batter.
meanings.sent2: The vanilla ice cream melted quickly in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The vanilla scent filled the kitchen, making everyone crave dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as smooth and comforting as a spoonful of vanilla.
meanings.sent5: The vanilla flavor lingered on my taste buds long after I finished the dessert.

meanings.definition: A pale yellowish-brown color like that of vanilla ice cream.
meanings.sent1: The walls were painted in a soft vanilla hue.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was the color of vanilla with a hint of caramel.
meanings.sent3: The vanilla shade of the curtains made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in shades of vanilla and peach.
meanings.sent5: The artist mixed colors to create the perfect vanilla tone for the painting.

meanings.definition: Lacking any special or extra features; ordinary or standard.
meanings.sent1: He preferred a vanilla lifestyle without any surprises.
meanings.sent2: The movie was entertaining but had a vanilla plot.
meanings.sent3: Her outfit was so vanilla that it blended into the background.
meanings.sent4: The speech was vanilla, lacking any memorable quotes.
meanings.sent5: The room was decorated in a simple, vanilla style, with no flashy elements.
